column4: Hi. I'm running an application with Wine. Unfortunately the executable was deleted, but the application still runs. Is it possible to recover the executable from the operative memory? Thank you in advance!
yes
amazingly
as for how...
pidof wine
that returns what?
and try pidof wineserver as well
are you there?
one minute.
the computer is in other room
The problem solved! I had a backup. Thank you all!
can i help though?
supposee you have an application open with a file that you deleted. you need to do something like.
pidof <app> or ps aux | grep app
thanks for hint. One more lesson for me!
now, (the pid for the latter command is the 1st number) you need to go to /proc/<pid>/
then to task/<pid>/fd
ls -l in there
notice thaat there are symbolic links that refer to the actual file. the trick here is that these links ARE the actual file
yes, I see!
so you can do something like cat number > /original/path/
and you've just recovered the file from app memory!
It works like magic! Thank you!!!!
